text: So basically none of it was true. I mean, the surprising thing to me was how viral this tweet went when ... Frankly, I actually look back at this person's other tweets. I think they worked at CB Insights, and the irony is the whole point of that business is to have good data, good data quality around private company data. And they just literally had incorrect numbers by a strong multiple on what our revenue scale was, what our growth rate was.
speaker: Howie Liu
context: Lenny asks Howie about a viral tweet that claimed Airtable was dead and had raised way more money than they were worth. Howie explains how the tweet contained completely incorrect data about Airtable's revenue and growth metrics. He notes the irony that the person who posted it worked at CB Insights, a company whose business model is built around providing accurate private company data, yet they shared completely wrong numbers.
text_ko: 결국 그 말들은 거의 다 사실이 아니었어요. 그러니까, 저한텐 더 놀라웠던 게 그 트윗(tweet)이 그렇게까지 퍼진 거예요... 솔직히 그 사람 다른 트윗들도 훑어봤는데, 제 생각엔 그 사람이 CB Insights에서 일했던 것 같아요. 아이러니한 건 그 회사가 비상장 기업 데이터(private company data)의 품질(data quality)을 관리하는 곳이라는 점이에요. 그런데 우리 매출 규모(revenue scale)나 성장률(growth rate)에 대한 수치가 문자 그대로 수 배는 틀리게 잘못 올라와 있었어요.
text_zh: 所以说基本上没有一个是对的。让我意外的是这条推特居然传播得这么广，我回头看了看这个人的其他推特，他好像在CB Insights工作，讽刺的是，他们公司的核心业务就是要有好的数据，特别是私人公司数据的质量要过硬。结果他们给出的数字完全是错的，不管是我们的营收规模还是增长率，差了好几倍。
text_es: Básicamente nada de eso era cierto. O sea, lo que más me sorprendió fue lo viral que se hizo ese tweet cuando... La verdad es que me puse a revisar los otros tweets de esta persona. Creo que trabajaba en CB Insights, y la ironía es que todo el enfoque de ese negocio es tener buenos datos, buena calidad de datos sobre empresas privadas. Y literalmente tenían números completamente incorrectos, por un margen enorme, sobre el tamaño de nuestros ingresos y nuestra tasa de crecimiento.

text: If you were literally founding a new company from scratch with the same mission, how would you execute on that mission using a fully AI native approach? If you can't, then you should find a buyer and then if you really care about this mission, go and start the next carnation of it.
speaker: Howie Liu
context: Howie discusses how established companies should evaluate their position in the AI era. He argues that founders need to take a clean slate approach and honestly assess whether they can better execute their mission with AI-native methods using their existing assets, or if they'd be better off starting fresh. This is part of his framework for how legacy companies should think about AI transformation.
text_ko: 만약 같은 미션으로 아예 백지에서 새 회사를 세운다고 하면, 완전한 AI 네이티브 접근(fully AI native approach)으로 그 미션을 어떻게 실행하겠어요? 그걸 못 하겠다면 회사를 사줄 인수자를 찾으세요. 그리고 그 미션을 진짜로 중요하게 생각한다면, 그 미션의 다음 버전(incarnation)을 직접 다시 시작하세요.
text_zh: 如果你真的要从零开始创立一家新公司，同样的使命，你会怎么用完全AI原生(AI native)的方法来实现？如果做不到的话，那就该找买家把公司卖了，然后如果你真的在乎这个使命，就去重新开始下一个版本。
text_es: Si literalmente fueras a fundar una empresa nueva desde cero con la misma misión, ¿cómo ejecutarías esa misión usando un enfoque completamente nativo de IA? Si no puedes hacerlo, entonces deberías buscar un comprador y luego, si realmente te importa esta misión, ve y arranca la siguiente versión de la misma.

text: If you want to cancel all your meetings for like a day or for an entire week and just go play around with every AI product you think could be relevant to Airtable, go do it.
speaker: Howie Liu
context: Lenny asks about changes Howie has made in expectations for his team to help them succeed in the AI era. Howie explains his philosophy of encouraging experimentation and play with AI tools. He actively tells his team members they can block out significant time - even a full week - to explore and experiment with AI products that might be relevant to their work at Airtable.
text_ko: 하루나 일주일쯤 모든 미팅을 다 취소하고 Airtable에 쓸모 있을 것 같은 AI 제품(AI product)들을 마음껏 써보고 싶다면, 그냥 그렇게 하세요.
text_zh: 如果你想把一天或者整个星期的会议都推掉，然后去试试那些可能对Airtable有用的AI产品，那就去做吧。
text_es: Si quieres cancelar todas tus reuniones por un día o incluso por toda una semana y ponerte a jugar con todos los productos de IA que creas que podrían ser relevantes para Airtable, hazlo.

text: It really does become more about individual attitude. There's a strong advantage to any of those three roles who can kind of cross over into the other two. As a PM, you need to start looking more like a hybrid PM prototyper, who has some good design sensibilities?
speaker: Howie Liu
context: Lenny asks about which functions on product teams (PM, engineering, design) have had the most success with AI productivity tools. Howie explains that success is less about the specific role and more about individual mindset and versatility. He argues that the most successful people are those who can cross over between disciplines - like PMs who can prototype and have design skills, rather than staying siloed in traditional role boundaries.
text_ko: 결국 더 중요한 건 개인의 태도예요. 세 역할 중 어느 쪽이든 다른 두 역할로 어느 정도 넘나들 수 있는 사람에게는 확실히 유리해요. 프로덕트 매니저(PM)라면 디자인 감각(design sensibilities)을 갖춘 하이브리드형 PM 프로토타이퍼(hybrid PM prototyper)에 더 가까워져야 하지 않을까요?
text_zh: 说到底还是个人态度的问题。这三个角色中，谁能跨界到其他两个领域，谁就占大便宜。作为PM，你得往混合型PM的方向发展，既能做原型(prototyper)，又要有不错的设计感觉。
text_es: Realmente se vuelve más una cuestión de actitud personal. Hay una gran ventaja para cualquiera de esos tres roles que pueda como que cruzar hacia los otros dos. Como PM, necesitas empezar a verte más como un PM híbrido que también hace prototipos, que tenga buen ojo para el diseño, ¿no?

text: I'm proud to say I am pretty sure I'm still the number one most expensive in inference cost user of Airtable AI, not just within our own company, but I think for a long time I was globally across all our customers vault. I mean, I'm extremely intentionally wasteful.
speaker: Howie Liu
context: Howie discusses his philosophy of using AI tools extensively as CEO. He explains how he personally uses AI heavily, even spending hundreds of dollars on inference costs for tasks like analyzing sales call transcripts. He describes being 'intentionally wasteful' with AI compute because the strategic insights gained are worth far more than the cost, comparing it to having a highly capable chief of staff analyze all company data.
text_ko: 자랑스럽게 말하자면, 제 생각엔 저는 아직도 Airtable AI에서 추론 비용(inference cost) 면에서 가장 비싼 사용자 1위인 것 같아요. 우리 회사 안에서뿐 아니라 오랫동안 전 세계 모든 고객을 통틀어서도 1위였던 것 같고요. 제 말은, 저는 정말 일부러 엄청 낭비를 해요.
text_zh: 我可以很自豪地说，我应该还是推理成本(inference cost)最高的Airtable AI用户，不光是在我们公司内部，我觉得很长一段时间我在全球所有客户里都是第一名。我的意思是，我就是故意这么浪费的。
text_es: Puedo decir con orgullo que estoy bastante seguro de que sigo siendo el usuario número uno con los costos de inferencia más altos de Airtable AI, no solo dentro de nuestra empresa, sino que creo que durante mucho tiempo fui el que más gastaba a nivel global entre todos nuestros clientes. O sea, soy extremadamente despilfarrador a propósito.

text: We now have what I call the fast thinking group, which officially is called AI platform, but it really means we want to just ship a bunch of new capabilities on a near weekly basis. And each of them should be truly awesome value. You should drop your jaw, how awesome it is to use this new capability in Airtable.
speaker: Howie Liu
context: Howie explains a recent reorganization at Airtable inspired by Daniel Kahneman's 'Thinking, Fast and Slow' concept. The fast thinking group focuses on rapidly shipping AI capabilities weekly, while a separate slow thinking group handles more deliberate, infrastructure-heavy work. This structure allows them to move at the breakneck pace of AI-native companies while still supporting larger enterprise deployments.
text_ko: 지금은 제가 '패스트 싱킹 그룹(fast thinking group)'이라고 부르는 조직이 있고, 공식 명칭은 AI 플랫폼(AI platform)이에요. 하지만 본질적으로는 거의 매주 새로운 기능을 한꺼번에 출시하고 싶다는 뜻이에요. 그리고 그 기능들 하나하나는 진짜로 압도적인 가치를 줘야 해요 — 에어테이블(Airtable)에서 이 새 기능을 써보고 입이 떡 벌어질 정도여야 해요.
text_zh: 我们现在有一个团队，我叫它"快速思考小组"，官方名字是AI平台(AI platform)，但实际上就是说我们要几乎每周都推出一堆新功能。而且每个功能都得真的超级有价值，让你用了之后会惊掉下巴，觉得"哇，在Airtable里用这个新功能也太牛了吧！"
text_es: Ahora tenemos lo que yo llamo el grupo de pensamiento rápido, que oficialmente se llama plataforma de IA, pero en realidad significa que queremos lanzar un montón de nuevas funcionalidades casi cada semana. Y cada una de ellas debería ser de un valor increíble. Debería dejarte con la boca abierta lo impresionante que es usar esta nueva funcionalidad en Airtable.

text: I think you actually have to take a clean slate approach to saying, 'How would our mission best be expressed? If you were literally founding a new company from scratch with the same mission, how would you execute on that mission using a fully AI native approach?' And then, by the way, do you have useful building blocks that you can leverage from your existing product and your existing business, or are you literally worse off having this legacy asset versus starting something from scratch?
speaker: Howie Liu
context: Howie discusses how established companies should approach AI transformation. He argues that companies can't just add AI features superficially but must fundamentally rethink their approach. This involves asking whether you can better execute your mission with your existing assets in an AI-native way, or if the legacy product actually hinders you compared to starting fresh. If the latter, he suggests selling and starting anew.
text_ko: 저는 사실 '미션(mission)을 가장 잘 표현하려면 어떻게 해야 할까? 만약 같은 미션으로 정말로 처음부터 새 회사를 세운다고 하면, 완전한 AI 네이티브(AI native) 방식으로 그 미션을 어떻게 실행하겠나?'처럼 백지 상태 접근법(clean slate approach)을 취해야 한다고 생각해요. 그리고 덧붙여, 기존 제품과 사업에서 활용할 만한 유용한 구성 요소(building blocks)가 있나요, 아니면 그 레거시 자산(legacy asset) 때문에 차라리 처음부터 새로 시작하는 게 더 나은 상황인가요?
text_zh: 我觉得你得彻底重新思考一下，问问自己'咱们的使命到底应该怎么体现？'如果你真的要从零开始创办一家新公司，使命还是一样的，你会怎么用完全AI原生(AI native)的方式来实现这个使命？然后呢，你再看看现有的产品和业务有没有什么有用的模块可以拿来用，还是说这些老资产(legacy asset)反而成了包袱，还不如从头开始？
text_es: Creo que realmente tienes que empezar desde cero y preguntarte: '¿Cómo podríamos expresar mejor nuestra misión? Si literalmente estuvieras fundando una empresa nueva desde el principio con la misma misión, ¿cómo ejecutarías esa misión usando un enfoque completamente nativo de IA?' Y luego, por cierto, ¿tienes componentes útiles que puedas aprovechar de tu producto actual y tu negocio existente, o realmente estás peor teniendo estos activos heredados (legacy assets) en lugar de empezar algo completamente de cero?
